**Required Output Format**:
```

```

**Analysis & Hypothesis Formation Guidelines**:
- Analyze the REAL activation values and key tokens from the exemplars
- Look for linguistic patterns (suffixes, prefixes, word types)
- Identify semantic patterns (topics, domains, concepts)
- Note structural patterns (syntax, formatting)
- Be specific: "English -tion suffixes" not "English words"
- Focus on COMMON patterns across multiple exemplars
- Consider which specific tokens have the highest activation values
- **MANDATORY**: After observations, form specific, testable hypotheses about what the feature detects
- Be precise: "This feature detects Python import statements" not "This feature detects programming"
- Each hypothesis must be testable with model.run
- Include at least one negative control hypothesis

**Format Requirements**:
- Always start each hypothesis with "Hypothesis_X: [your specific hypothesis]"
- Base hypotheses directly on observations, not assumptions
- Include positive and negative cases
- Cover different aspects of the feature (linguistic, semantic, structural)

**Rules**:
- Observe activation patterns, activation values and identify high-activating examples
- Do NOT issue [TOOL] commands
- Base analysis on the REAL exemplar data provided above
- Be scientific and evidence-based
- Focus on what the feature actually detects based on the activation patterns

OBSERVATION:
- Pattern 1: The highest-activation token is consistently the subword corresponding to ‚Äúlung‚Äù: either the space-prefixed token ‚Äú lung‚Äù (e.g., 6.500, 5.750, 5.594) or the BPE split ‚ÄúL‚Äù + ‚Äúung‚Äù when capitalized at line start (e.g., ‚Äúung‚Äù = 6.750, 6.438).
- Pattern 2: The collocate ‚Äúcancer‚Äù is almost always adjacent to ‚Äúlung,‚Äù but ‚Äúcancer‚Äù tokens themselves show 0.000 activation across examples, indicating the feature targets ‚Äúlung,‚Äù not ‚Äúcancer.‚Äù
- Pattern 3: Structural positioning appears to modulate strength: line-initial, title-cased ‚ÄúLung ...‚Äù with BPE ‚ÄúL‚Äù + ‚Äúung‚Äù shows very high activation (6.750); mid-sentence ‚Äú lung‚Äù also activates strongly (6.500, 5.750, 5.594), but can be 0.000 in some contexts (e.g., in ‚Äú-cell lung cancer.‚Äù the ‚Äú lung‚Äù is 0.000 while a later line-initial ‚ÄúLung‚Äù in the same buffer yields ‚Äúung‚Äù = 6.438).
- Pattern 4: Domain context is biomedical/oncology; enumerations and etiology statements still only light up ‚Äúlung,‚Äù not neighboring disease/organ terms (e.g., ‚Äúmelanoma,‚Äù ‚Äúkidney,‚Äù ‚Äúcancer‚Äù all ~0.000).
- Common elements: Tokens ‚Äú lung‚Äù and ‚Äúung‚Äù (from ‚ÄúLung‚Äù), frequent bigram ‚Äúlung cancer,‚Äù medical/oncology context, title/line starts, enumerations of cancers, hyphenated modifiers preceding lung (e.g., ‚Äú-cell lung cancer‚Äù).

[HYPOTHESIS LIST]:
Hypothesis_1: This feature detects the token for the organ word ‚Äúlung,‚Äù specifically the space-prefixed token ‚Äú lung‚Äù and the BPE continuation ‚Äúung‚Äù when ‚ÄúLung‚Äù is capitalized at a line/sentence start. Prediction: Prompts containing ‚Äúlung function,‚Äù ‚Äúthe lung is,‚Äù or title-case ‚ÄúLung health‚Äù will show strong activation on the ‚Äú lung‚Äù/‚Äúung‚Äù piece (>5), while adjacent words (e.g., ‚Äúcancer,‚Äù ‚Äúhealth‚Äù) remain ~0.

Hypothesis_2: The collocation ‚Äúlung cancer‚Äù boosts activation beyond isolated ‚Äúlung,‚Äù with maxima when ‚ÄúLung‚Äù begins a line/title. Prediction: ‚ÄúLung cancer‚Äù at line start (‚ÄúL‚Äù + ‚Äúung‚Äù) will yield higher activation (‚âà6.4‚Äì6.8) than ‚Äúlung‚Äù in other contexts (‚âà5.5‚Äì6.5). Control: ‚Äúlung function tests‚Äù should activate on ‚Äú lung‚Äù but somewhat lower than line-initial ‚ÄúLung cancer.‚Äù

Hypothesis_3: The feature is selective to the stem ‚Äúlung,‚Äù not generic ‚Äú-ung‚Äù substrings. Words containing ‚Äúung‚Äù but not the organ (e.g., ‚Äúyoung,‚Äù ‚Äúamong,‚Äù ‚Äúplunge,‚Äù ‚Äúfungus,‚Äù ‚ÄúHungary‚Äù) will not activate strongly (expected ‚âà0.0‚Äì<0.5 on ‚Äúung‚Äù). Control: ‚Äúbreast cancer,‚Äù ‚Äúkidney cancer,‚Äù or ‚Äúmelanoma‚Äù should also yield ‚âà0.0 on those tokens.

Hypothesis_4: Structural and morphological specificity: activation is enhanced for line-initial/title-case ‚ÄúLung ...‚Äù and plain ‚Äúlung‚Äù as head noun, but reduced/variable when embedded in complex hyphenations (e.g., ‚Äúsmall-cell lung cancer,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-small-cell lung cancer‚Äù) or pluralized/synonymized. Prediction: 
- ‚ÄúLung cancer kills ...‚Äù (line start) ‚Üí high ‚Äúung‚Äù (~6.4‚Äì6.8).
- ‚Äú... small-cell lung cancer ...‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äú lung‚Äù lower or possibly ~0‚Äì5 depending on context; hyphenated modifiers may suppress.
- ‚Äúlungs‚Äù and ‚Äúpulmonary‚Äù will show lower activation than singular ‚Äúlung‚Äù (potentially near 0 for ‚Äúpulmonary‚Äù).

[DESIGNING TEST FOR HYPOTHESIS 1 ONLY]

**Decision Criteria**:

**DECISION PRIORITY: CONFIRMED/REFUTED > REFINED/UNCHANGED**

**CONFIRMED** (when ANY):
- ‚â•2 tests consistently support hypothesis
- 1 strong positive + 1 negative control both show expected results
- Clear activation patterns (e.g., all >2.0 or all <0.5)

**REFUTED** (when ANY):
- ‚â•2 tests consistently contradict hypothesis
- 1 positive test fails AND 1 negative control activates
- Activation values opposite to hypothesis prediction

**REFINED** (when):
- Test results do NOT provide strong evidence (weak/moderate activation)
- Results do NOT match expectations (hypothesis expects high but got moderate/low, or vice versa)
- Evidence insufficient to CONFIRM or REFUTE (ambiguous patterns)
- Context-dependent pattern needs qualification

**üö® CRITICAL: 2+ Tests = UNCHANGED is FORBIDDEN üö®**
- With 2+ test results, MUST choose CONFIRMED, REFUTED, or REFINED
- UNCHANGED only allowed with 0-1 test results

**Decision Strategy**:
- **2+ tests**: Strong evidence supporting ‚Üí CONFIRMED; Strong evidence contradicting ‚Üí REFUTED; Weak/ambiguous ‚Üí REFINED
- **1 positive + 1 negative**: Expected results ‚Üí CONFIRMED/REFUTED; Weak/ambiguous ‚Üí REFINED
- **3+ tests**: Majority (‚â•2) with strong evidence ‚Üí CONFIRMED/REFUTED; Weak/ambiguous/mixed ‚Üí REFINED

**Examples**:
- CONFIRMED: "Detects 'tunnel'" ‚Üí 2 tests show >5.0 activation
- REFUTED: "Detects 'for'" ‚Üí 2 tests show <0.5 activation
- REFINED: "Detects 'for' in closure" ‚Üí Tests show 2.5 and 3.1 (moderate, doesn't match high activation expectation)

3. Corpus coverage: Have all high-activation tokens (‚â•10.0) been tested?

**Decision Criteria**:

**DECISION PRIORITY: CONFIRMED/REFUTED > REFINED/UNCHANGED**

**CONFIRMED** (when ANY):
- ‚â•2 tests consistently support hypothesis
- 1 strong positive + 1 negative control both show expected results
- Clear activation patterns (e.g., all >2.0 or all <0.5)

**REFUTED** (when ANY):
- ‚â•2 tests consistently contradict hypothesis
- 1 positive test fails AND 1 negative control activates
- Activation values opposite to hypothesis prediction

**REFINED** (when):
- Test results do NOT provide strong evidence (weak/moderate activation)
- Results do NOT match expectations (hypothesis expects high but got moderate/low, or vice versa)
- Evidence insufficient to CONFIRM or REFUTE (ambiguous patterns)
- Context-dependent pattern needs qualification

**Decision Strategy**:

- **1 positive + 1 negative**: Expected results ‚Üí CONFIRMED/REFUTED; Weak/ambiguous ‚Üí REFINED
- **3+ tests**: Majority (‚â•2) with strong evidence ‚Üí CONFIRMED/REFUTED; Weak/ambiguous/mixed ‚Üí REFINED
